errorResponses.reason: is returned if the graph was created successfully and waitForSync was true.
is returned if the graph was created successfully and waitForSync was false.
is returned if it failed. The response body contains an error document in this case.

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until document has been sync to disk.

parameters.name: graph
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the following attributes: _key: The name of the new graph. vertices: The name of the vertices collection. edges: The name of the egde collection.

operations.notes:
Creates a new graph.

Returns an object with an attribute graph containing a list of all graph properties.
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/
{"_key":"graph","vertices":"vertices","edges":"edges"}

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 113852839

{ 
  "graph" : { 
    "_id" : "_graphs/graph", 
    "_rev" : "113852839", 
    "_key" : "graph", 
    "edges" : "edges", 
    "vertices" : "vertices" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 201 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the graph was found (in case graph-name was specified) or the list of graphs was assembled successfully (in case graph-name was not specified).
is returned if the graph was not found. This response code may only be returned if graph-name is specified in the request. The response body contains an error document in this case.
"If-None-Match" header is given and the current graph has not a different version. This response code may only be returned if graph-name is specified in the request.
"If-Match" header or rev is given and the current graph has a different version. This response code may only be returned if graph-name is specified in the request.

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: If graph-name is specified, then this header can be used to check whether a specific graph has changed or not.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If graph-name is specified, then this header can be used to check whether a specific graph has changed or not.

operations.notes:
If graph-name is specified, returns an object with an attribute graph containing a JSON hash with all properties of the specified graph.

If graph-name is not specified, returns a list of graph objects.
operations.summary: get the properties of a specific or all graphs
operations.examples:
get graph by name 

unix> curl --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 116146599

{ 
  "graph" : { 
    "_id" : "_graphs/graph", 
    "_rev" : "116146599", 
    "_key" : "graph", 
    "edges" : "edges", 
    "vertices" : "vertices" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}

get all graphs 

unix> curl --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "graphs" : [ 
    { 
      "_id" : "_graphs/graph2", 
      "_rev" : "120603047", 
      "_key" : "graph2", 
      "edges" : "edges2", 
      "vertices" : "vertices2" 
    }, 
    { 
      "_id" : "_graphs/graph1", 
      "_rev" : "118505895", 
      "_key" : "graph1", 
      "edges" : "edges1", 
      "vertices" : "vertices1" 
    } 
  ], 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the graph was deleted and waitForSync was true.
is returned if the graph was deleted and waitForSync was false.
is returned if the graph was not found. The response body contains an error document in this case.
"If-Match" header or rev is given and the current graph has a different version

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If the "If-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is returned, if it has the same revision ad the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 412 is returned. As an alternative you can supply the etag in an attribute rev in the URL.

operations.examples:
delete graph by name 

unix> curl -X DELETE --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "deleted" : true, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the graph was created successfully and waitForSync was true.
is returned if the graph was created successfully and waitForSync was false.

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until document has been sync to disk.

parameters.name: vertex
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the vertex properties: - _key: The name of the vertex (optional). - further optional attributes.

operations.notes:
Creates a vertex in a graph.

Returns an object with an attribute vertex containing a list of all vertex properties.
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex
{"_key":"v1","optional1":"val1"}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 126108071

{ 
  "vertex" : { 
    "_id" : "vertices/v1", 
    "_rev" : "126108071", 
    "_key" : "v1", 
    "optional1" : "val1" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 202 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the graph was found
"If-Match" header is given and the current graph has not a different  version
is returned if the graph or vertex was not found. The response body contains an error document in this case.
"If-None-Match" header or rev is given and the current graph has a different version

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: rev
parameters.description: Revision of a vertex

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: If the "If-None-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is returned, if it has a different revision than the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 304 is returned.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If the "If-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is returned, if it has the same revision ad the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 412 is returned. As an alternative you can supply the etag in an attribute rev in the URL.

operations.notes: Returns an object with an attribute vertex containing a list of all vertex properties.
operations.examples:
get vertex properties by name 

unix> curl --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex/v1

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 128926119

{ 
  "vertex" : { 
    "_id" : "vertices/v1", 
    "_rev" : "128926119", 
    "_key" : "v1", 
    "optional1" : "val1" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the vertex was deleted and waitForSync was true.
is returned if the vertex was deleted and waitForSync was false.
is returned if the graph or the vertex was not found. The response body contains an error document in this case.
"If-Match" header or rev is given and the current vertex has a different version

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If the "If-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is returned, if it has the same revision ad the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 412 is returned. As an alternative you can supply the etag in an attribute rev in the URL.

operations.notes: Deletes vertex and all in and out edges of the vertex
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X DELETE --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex/v1

content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

  "code" : 202 
}

parameters.name: rev
parameters.description: Revision of a vertex

parameters.name: vertex
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the new vertex properties.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: If the "If-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is updated, if it has the same revision ad the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 412 is returned. As an alternative you can supply the etag in an attribute rev in the URL.

operations.notes:
Replaces the vertex properties.

Returns an object with an attribute vertex containing a list of all vertex properties.
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X PUT --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex/v1
{"optional1":"val2"}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 135741863

{

    "_id" : "vertices/v1",

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the vertex was updated successfully and waitForSync was true.

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until vertex has been sync to disk.

parameters.name: rev
parameters.description: Revision of a vertex

parameters.name: keepNull
parameters.description: Modify the behavior of the patch command to remove any attribute

parameters.name: graph
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the properties to patch.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description: If the "If-Match" header is given, then it must contain exactly one etag. The document is updated, if it has the same revision ad the given etag. Otherwise a HTTP 412 is returned. As an alternative you can supply the etag in an attribute rev in the URL.

operations.notes:
Partially updates the vertex properties.

Setting an attribute value to null in the patch document will cause a value of null be saved for the attribute by default. If the intention is to delete existing attributes with the patch command, the URL parameter keepNull can be used with a value of false. This will modify the behavior of the patch command to remove any attributes from the existing document that are contained in the patch document with an attribute value of null.

Returns an object with an attribute vertex containing a list of all vertex properties.
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X PATCH --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex/v1
{"optional1":"vertexPatch"}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 139084199

{ 
  "vertex" : { 
    "_id" : "vertices/v1", 
    "_rev" : "139084199", 
    "_key" : "v1", 
    "optional1" : "vertexPatch" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 202 
}

unix> curl -X PATCH --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/vertex/v1
{"optional1":null}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 139608487

{ 
  "vertex" : { 
    "_id" : "vertices/v1", 
    "_rev" : "139608487", 
    "_key" : "v1", 
    "optional1" : null 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 202 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the cursor was created

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body to filter the result:

operations.notes:
Returns a cursor.

The call expects a JSON hash array as body to filter the result:

- batchSize: the batch size of the returned cursor- limit: limit the result size- count: return the total number of results (default "false")- filter: a optional filter

The attributes of filter - properties: filter by an array of vertex properties

The attributes of a property filter - key: filter the result vertices by a key value pair- value: the value of the key- compare: a compare operator

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the cursor was created

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: graph
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body to filter the result:

operations.notes:
Returns a cursor.

The call expects a JSON hash array as body to filter the result:

- batchSize: the batch size of the returned cursor- limit: limit the result size- count: return the total number of results (default "false")- filter: a optional filter

The attributes of filter - direction: Filter for inbound (value "in") or outbound (value "out") neighbors. Default value is "any". - labels: filter by an array of edge labels (empty array means no restriction)- properties: filter neighbors by an array of edge properties

The attributes of a property filter - key: filter the result vertices by a key value pair- value: the value of the key- compare: a compare operator

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the edge was created successfully and waitForSync was true.
is returned if the edge was created successfully and waitForSync was false.

parameters.name: graph-name
parameters.description: The name of the graph

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until edge has been sync to disk.

parameters.name: edge
parameters.description: The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the edge properties:

operations.notes:
Creates an edge in a graph.

The call expects a JSON hash array as body with the edge properties:

- _key: The name of the edge.- _from: The name of the from vertex.- _to: The name of the to vertex.- $label: A label for the edge (optional).- further optional attributes.

Returns an object with an attribute edge containing the list of all edge properties.
operations.examples:
unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/graph/graph/edge
{"_key":"edge1","_from":"vert2","_to":"vert1","optional1":"val1"}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: 162021799

{ 
  "edge" : { 
    "_id" : "edges/edge1", 
    "_rev" : "162021799", 
    "_key" : "edge1", 
    "_from" : "vertices/vert2", 
    "_to" : "vertices/vert1", 
    "$label" : null, 
    "optional1" : "val1" 
  }, 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 202 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if the edge was found
"If-Match" header is given and the current edge has not a different  version
is returned if the graph or edge was not found. The response body contains an error document in this case.
"If-None-Match" header or rev is given and the current edge has a different version

parameters.name: if-match

}

operations.notes:

- batchSize: the batch size of the returned cursor- limit: limit the result size- count: return the total number of results (default "false")- filter: a optional filter

The attributes of filter - direction: Filter for inbound (value "in") or outbound (value "out") neighbors. Default value is "any". - labels: filter by an array of edge labels- properties: filter neighbors by an array of properties

The attributes of a property filter - key: filter the result vertices by a key value pair- value: the value of the key- compare: a compare operator
